unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi saw a spike of 200+ cases of suspected "Delhi Belly" post the Diwali sweet binge. Dr. Kumar, Head of Emergency, quipped, "Looks like everyone took 'sweet dreams' a little too literally! We're running out of ORS packets faster than you can say 'gulab jamun'." The ER saw a surge of patients complaining of abdominal cramps and related issues around 2 AM.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi saw a spike of two hundred plus cases of suspected "Delhi Belly" post the Diwali sweet binge. Doctor Kumar, Head of Emergency, quipped, "Looks like everyone took 'sweet dreams' a little too literally! We're running out of O-R-S packets faster than you can say 'gulab jamun'." The E-R saw a surge of patients complaining of abdominal cramps and related issues around two A-M.

unnormalised: One particularly memorable case involved Mr. Sharma, who claimed he ate 1 kg of Motichoor ladoos. "I thought I was doing my bit for the economy," he groaned, "Now my stomach’s doing its bit to sabotage me!" The hospital had to call in extra nurses for the "sweet emergency", and rumour has it, they’re considering stocking up on digestive biscuits next Diwali.
normalised: One particularly memorable case involved Mister Sharma, who claimed he ate one kilogram of Motichoor ladoos. "I thought I was doing my bit for the economy," he groaned, "Now my stomach’s doing its bit to sabotage me!" The hospital had to call in extra nurses for the "sweet emergency", and rumour has it, they’re considering stocking up on digestive biscuits next Diwali.

unnormalised: The influx strained resources, with IV drips running low and the waiting room resembling a mela of misery. According to internal reports 75% of the patients were men aged between 25-45 yrs. One senior nurse even joked that they should start charging a 'Diwali Sweet Tax' to cover the costs.
normalised: The influx strained resources, with I-V drips running low and the waiting room resembling a mela of misery. According to internal reports seventy five percent of the patients were men aged between twenty five to forty five years. One senior nurse even joked that they should start charging a 'Diwali Sweet Tax' to cover the costs.

unnormalised: While the situation was serious, the staff managed to maintain their humour. Dr. Kapoor, a junior resident, was seen wearing a t-shirt that read, "I survived the Diwali Digestion Disaster of '24!" He added, "It's all fun and games until someone needs a colonoscopy!"
normalised: While the situation was serious, the staff managed to maintain their humour. Doctor Kapoor, a junior resident, was seen wearing a T-shirt that read, "I survived the Diwali Digestion Disaster of twenty four!" He added, "It's all fun and games until someone needs a colonoscopy!"

unnormalised: The hospital admin has sent out public advisory requesting citizens to enjoy Diwali in moderation. The notice explicitly reads "Maximum sweet consumption: 250 gms. Exceed at your own risk." If you find yourself regretting your Diwali feasting, remember: AIIMS Delhi (dial 102) is always open, but maybe stick to one rasgulla next time, okay?
normalised: The hospital admin has sent out public advisory requesting citizens to enjoy Diwali in moderation. The notice explicitly reads "Maximum sweet consumption: two hundred and fifty grams. Exceed at your own risk." If you find yourself regretting your Diwali feasting, remember: A-I-I-M-S Delhi (dial one hundred and two) is always open, but maybe stick to one rasgulla next time, okay?
